I feel like this app tries to keep it 50/50 rather then actually make it feel like a real coin flip.

title: Best Coin Flipping App
comment: I took the time to download the top listed coin flipping apps to determine which was the best, and this one is certainly the winner. 1)Most app contained an ad box and/or internet permission (for updated adds), but this one does not. 2)This is also the only app I noticed which allows you to run a diagnostic test, ensuring that the flips are both 50% likely (the whole point of the app). 3)This app just looked sleekest and simplest, and even included an option to turn flip graphics off (faster results).

title: Almost!
comment: Have to give it four stars because on my LG G Watch R the coin does not show up centered.  It's up and to the left and a little bit of the coin is cut off.  IF it was centered it would be perfect.  I'm sure a fix will happen eventually, but you may want to take note developer and test it out.  Also, another Android Wear issue is that when I have random selected it still sticks with the Minnesota coin and never changes to any of the other coins I have as options.
The G Watch R isn't available in the USA yet, so I can't test, but I think I identified the layout problem.  It should be fixed in version 6.2.1.  Thanks!
Nice
Tails to heads to tails to heads repeat x25 flips, is it not random ?

Hi Tom,

Unfortunately patterns or streaks to one side can and do happen over short intervals. The effect is known as a "Clustering Illusion" (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Clustering_illusion). To verify randomness, you can run the app's Diagnostic Test feature by clicking the pie chart icon on the Action Bar.

Thanks!

title: Works as advertised.
comment: I only have one issue with this app, though. If you only switch to another app instead of manually exiting out by either pressing back or choosing exit from the menu, it still works in the background so you'll feel your phone vibrate for every coin flip as a result of your phone being shook just enough (and it's very sensitive).   Other than that, it's a great app that I always keep on my phone.
I was finally able to reproduce this issue and found the bug!  New version with the fix will be posted soon.  Thanks for the feedback!

title: Best Coin Flip Out There
comment: No permissions make this the best flip app.
Coin toss always shows heads for first time

Unfortunately streaks to one side can and do happen over short intervals.  This is why some people get lucky in Vegas.  Run the built-in diagnostics and flip the coin several hundred thousand times to verify a 50/50 distribution.  Also, the source code is available for inspection to verify that there aren't any "cheats" in the app.

title: OMFG
comment: This is a huge amount of fun. It baffles me to see that people get closed-source, ad-laden programs where clean, elegant, open-source alternatives exist. This gentleman obviously does something creative with computers for a living. It reminds me of the time my roommate's brother-in-law fixed our boom-box. He was an electrical engineer at one of  the national nuclear labs, and the result was consequently way better than it needed to be.  Thanks for a fun (and suspiciously perfect) app!  :)

title: Required me to Restart my Phone to Close the App
comment: Otherwise I'd get that incessant "coin flip" noise every time my phone moved the slightest bit.  First I closed the app, but the sound continued.  Then I used Task Manager to force close the app...STILL the sound continues.  Then I used Task Manager to close ALL active apps...STILL the annoying sound every time my phone moves.  So I'm forced to restart.    I've disabled the sound, but that's just a bandaid.  I don't like idea of this program starting a process that can't be terminated.  Never had this happen w any other app, hence the 1 star.
This issue has been resolved in version 5.4.2.

(Changeable background would be nice too... but sound is more important in my book)
